body_html:
@labor00, sorry you're having issues building - we'll try and help. First question - are you building with setup.py? For example:

python setup.py install  # or python setup.py build_deps develop

or are you using CMake directly? Generally we should have -DUSE_SYSTEM_EIGEN_INSTALL=OFF as the default, so you will use the third_party/ version.

I'm not sure why InputSize() isn't callable in that location... we do have CentOS builds in CI, so I'm not sure why you'd have this issue on Fedora.

cc @Yangqing and @pjh5 just in case they've seen this.

I'm not sure why InputSize() isn't callable in that location... we do have CentOS builds in CI, so I'm not sure why you'd have this issue on Fedora.

body:
@labor00, sorry you're having issues building - we'll try and help. First question - are you building with setup.py? For example:

```
python setup.py install  # or python setup.py build_deps develop
```

or are you using CMake directly? Generally we should have -DUSE_SYSTEM_EIGEN_INSTALL=OFF as the default, so you will use the third_party/ version.

I'm not sure why `InputSize()` isn't callable in that location... we do have CentOS builds in CI, so I'm not sure why you'd have this issue on Fedora.

cc @Yangqing and @pjh5 just in case they've seen this.
